fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1021].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a project in JIRA with Service Desk
# Associate two groups (let's say group A and group B) with the Service Desk Team role
# Grant the "Assign Issue" permission only to group A and "Current Assignee", and remove the Service Desk Team from this permission (be sure that group B is not included here)
# Grant the "Assignable user" permission to the Service Desk Team (which will include the two groups)

h3. Current behaviour

- The user from group B won't be able to assign issues, neither reassign issues assigned to him as it should. If you test this same behaviour on any other JIRA project which doesn't use Service Desk, it will work fine.
- Accessing Service Desk will result in an error screen. This screen is attached in this ticket.
- Clicking on the "Repair" option of the error message will add the "Service Desk Team" project role to the permissions again.
- Clicking on the "Repair" option will also display the list of "wrong" configurations in the permission scheme.

h3. Why it would be useful to work like this?

Users may be agents and work in Service Desk tickets, but with restrictions. In this case, the users will be an agent, as he will work on the tickets but he will have restrictions, as he will only be able to work in tickets assigned to him.

h3. Expected behaviour

If the user is already counting as an Agent (hence not going against the new license policy), allow the permission to be properly customised as in other JIRA projects which doesn't user Service Desk

h3. Obs.

- Please notice that this will occur for many other permissions as well, such as "Edit Issues", etc.
- This is related to the new licensing, as these configurations worked as expected in Service Desk 1.2.7, as the "Service Desk Team" project role could be removed from any permission of the project.
- The "Repair" message refers to some of the permissions as "recommended" when they are actually mandatory, maybe we should also adjust this message.
fields.summary: Remove restrictions on the Service Desk Team project role
Only thread related emails in GMail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1016].
  {panel}

When creating a new issue through Jira servicedesk the "reported by" field is not able to pick from previous reporters. It works fine through the "Create new issue (c)"-view and via the project, but not via the new servicedesk.

I have attached a side by side screenshot where the tag is not working.  

In the attachment i am trying to tag "reported by" with 'Sofia' (left view). 
It does not work in the servicedesk, but it works in the right view in the project view.
fields.summary: "Reported by" tags inconsistent in new servicedesk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1015].
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Updated as of 17 Mar 2021}
Hey all,

We are strategically looking at this issue, and the broader Customer Management story. We are working on the associated dependencies, and are planning on outcomes beginning after June 2021. I will update again as we pass through the mid-year planning cycle. 

I am interested in learning more about organisations who are looking to synchronise customers via AD, and why they are not using Atlassian Access.

If this is you, let me know. 

Cheers, 

Ben
{panel}
 
h3. Problem Definition

We have not found a way to integrated AD with JSD, to automatically add and sync all users of a specific security group.

Our understanding, from reading the documentation and from testing the service desk, is that currently customers have to "sign up", e.g. to create a new user, not integrated with AD and with a different password.
h3. Suggested Solution

We would like to be able to use a specific AD security group, even Domain Users, to add automatically users to the JSD customers group, and to let these users to use their AD credentials to login to JSD.
h3. Note

This is only for JIRA On-Demand. If you are using JIRA Server, then it's possible and please refer to JSD-4333.
fields.summary: Active Directory integration for customers
SLA is cleared when the field is present in the Edit Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1006].
  {panel}

Currently, in the documentation for [Service Desk Agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Agent+-+JIRA+Service+Desk], there is no mention of what someone should look out for if their users are not listed as agents within the Service Desk (despite being in the proper group).

Here are some things that could be inserted to make things clearer :

* The *JIRA Service Desk agent access* global permission should be mentioned
* The assignment of agents to their respective Service Desk, that can be accessed via the 'Service Desk Agents' menu in the Administration
fields.summary: Have better documentation regarding Service Desk Agents
Add issue timezone update possibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1002].
  {panel}

Hi guys/gals, thought I'd try and offer some suggestions from what I'm seeing in your ServiceDesk plugin.

I'd raised a ticket with  yourselves about the SLA's not sorting and being all over the place. But your guy Yit Wei explained what was happening for me (https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/SDS-1941). While I get it and understand it, this still leaves me having to apologise to the ServiceDesk manager who now can't really show the data in the format that she wants in her month end reports. The only way round this is going to be Structure Plugin, that allows her to go and resort these as she likes.

While I get that for a SD user, this is OK, If they're completed most of the SLAs will not be an issue. But for a month/year end report on tickets, you'd expect this to be achievable.

So while you have a complex field that renders the information on the screen, it's not that sortable. Though setting an SLA filter and a Subscription, allows you to get the data pretty well output to email, which you can then paste into excel. So that's the only option she has to manually sort it once it is spat out from JIRA.

My suggestion would be to have a separate field, that wouldn't necessarily  be viewable, that you could referance when doing your sort. I'm no programmer, but I would like to think that you could do something that would generate the figure in a natural number format that could be output and then sorted. Leaving the original SLA fields as is, since they are so handy to use and see what is live. But at least you'd be able to sort them on SLA, rather than just the live ones.

As to the existing method of sorting, I'd probably suggest that they would be sortable via a secondary "order by", if that is possible.

Anyway am rambling now. Please let me know if you manage to update any of these.

Thanks,

Graeme A
fields.summary: SLA Sorting in ServiceDesk
When can we have Wiki Rendered for TExt field in JSD ?
Enable Project Admin to clone a request type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-998].
  {panel}

Hi

I would really appreciate an option or setting where you can decide whether a user sees a specific user portal request type or not.

For example: 
I would like to create a request type where a team leader can request the removal of a user's information because the employee has left the company.

Now it wouldn't make sense if everyone can see this request type because this is clearly an administrative task.

What I would wish for:
I create a group called "Team Leaders" and add all team leaders. Now I go to the request type and say "Only show this request type to users in group: Team Leaders".

Same functionality for the categories would be nice too!

Regards
fields.summary: Showing user portal categories based on permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-994].
  {panel}

Hi there, 

We are testing the JIRA Service Desk form few weeks and we came across the issue below JIRA OnDemand: 

Issue:
When Agent makes any updates or add comments in an “issue” (ticket), reporter receives notification email but “Display name” shows reporter name instead of agent’s name who updated the issue (ticket). 

Current Configuration:

System:
We have configured JIRA Administration  Systems  General Configuration  Settings  General Settings Email from as “${fullname}
We have also tried ${email} and ${email.hostname}
Changing these variable does not make any difference in the notifications.  

Project (JIRA Service Desk): 
We have also configured support@xyz.co.uk as a notification email address for the JIRA Service Desk. 

Can anyone urgently help us to resolve this issue?

Kind regards, 

Tariq Nazir
fields.summary: Notification email shows reporter name instead of agent’s name in "From Field"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-992].
  {panel}

We currently use JIRA for customer support. 

We do have over 1500 different people/customers with an account. Using groups and security level to divide these customers in different groups. So customers working for the same company could see each others issue and not the issues from other companies. 

Now we are thinking about moving to JIRA Service Desk, but I am not able to find any functionality to use security levels of some sort for customers. 

This is one of our main requirements for a support system,

Laura

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Service Desk, under *Customers* tab page it will list all users who can create and view a Service Desk issue. This includes listing Agents and Collaborators on the same tab. See [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Setting+up+JIRA+Service+Desk+users].
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if there is an option to only show *Customers* on this page to differentiate between JIRA users and Customers. Since Service Desk users/customers do not have group, it is hard to search in JIRA by going to _User Management > Users_ as well.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-976].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Integrate JIRA with Crowd/LDAP
# Set the Permission to "Read/Write"
# Move it to the top of the Directory List.
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration > General Configuration > Edit Settings_
# Turn On the "External User Management" option.
# Navigate to the current User Profile and the "Change Password" link is gone.
# Access JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal.
# Access the User Profile.

*Expected Result*:
The "Change Password" is removed from the profile same as JIRA User Profile as expected from 
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27280

*Actual Result*:
The "Change Password" link is still appear and if the Directory permission in Crowd is set to true for "Modify User" the password will be changed.

!pass.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Change Password" link is not hidden when "External User Management" is ON

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-969].
  {panel}

If the Resolution field is hidden on JIRA for this Service Desk project, requests won't appear on the Customer Portal's My requests for the Open requests and Closed requests filters, just for the All requests filter.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk project
# Go to its Customer Portal and create some requests
# Go to this Service Desk project's administration on JIRA and hide the Resolution field
# Go back to the Customer Portal and create new requests
# Go to My requests and note that the requests that were created after the Resolution field was hidden only show if you select the All requests filter

h4. Workaround:
Make the Resolution field visible for this Service Desk project on JIRA and trigger a reindex on JIRA.
fields.summary: Service Desk requests show only the All Requests filter on My requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-968].
  {panel}

Hello,

I'd like to submit some feedback on the Collaborator role in Service Desk. The inability to assign issues to Collaborators or allow Collaborators to log work against the ticket is serious blocker to our adopting the product. Without a change in this functionality we cannot adopt Service Desk--as much as I like the offering.

The advice proposed in the documentation is to clone tickets into another project or to mention developers to get their attention.

Cloning or duplicating issues doesn't really work for us and is only applicable to an actual bug report where multiple support issues were raised on it. Most cases that can't be resolved by an agent are escalated to a developer or PM for 2nd/3rd level review. Simply mentioning a Jira user isn't accountable enough, it needs assignable and trackable without duplicating the tickets.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Ability to Assign Service Desk Tickets to Collaborators
Create SLA goal using days or weeks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-956].
  {panel}

Reporter display name used as From Name in email notifications

{noformat}
      new ServiceDeskEmail(
        recipient = reporter,
        fromName = reporter.getDisplayName,
{noformat}

The above appears multiple times in servicedesk/plugin/src/main/scala/com/atlassian/servicedesk/internal/notifications/render/ServiceDeskIssueNotificationRenderer.scala

		
When the email is rendered and sent:

{noformat}
2014-10-09 19:39:55,344 Sending mailitem To='sxsw@XXX' Subject='[TWO] test [TWO-9]' From='null' FromName='sxsw' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='jt-two@XXX' InReplyTo='<JIRA.10500.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA>' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='null' MessageId='null' DEBUG tim 1179x2070x1 1z5ido 192.168.56.1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [com.atlassian.mail.outgoing] DATA
2014-10-09 19:39:55,389 Sending mailitem To='sxsw@XXX' Subject='[TWO] test [TWO-9]' From='null' FromName='sxsw' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='jt-two@XXX' InReplyTo='<JIRA.10500.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA>' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='null' MessageId='null' DEBUG tim 1179x2070x1 1z5ido 192.168.56.1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [com.atlassian.mail.outgoing] 354 End data with <CR><LF>.<CR><LF>
2014-10-09 19:39:55,455 Sending mailitem To='sxsw@XXX' Subject='[TWO] test [TWO-9]' From='null' FromName='sxsw' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='jt-two@XXX' InReplyTo='<JIRA.10500.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA>' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='null' MessageId='null' DEBUG tim 1179x2070x1 1z5ido 192.168.56.1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [com.atlassian.mail.outgoing] Date: Thu, 9 Oct 2014 19:39:54 -0500 (CDT)
From: sxsw <jiratest@XXX>
Reply-To: jt-two@XXX
To: sxsw@XXX
Message-ID: <JIRA.10500.XXX.15.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA>
In-Reply-To: <JIRA.10500.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA>
References: <JIRA.10500.XXX@Atlassian.JIRA> <JIRA.10500.XXX@READ>
{noformat}
* Reporter = sxsw
* Outgoing SMTP Mail server address = jiratest
* Service desk's inbound email address = jt-two

Notice the "From:" inside the mailitem content. The name attached to "From" should be the name of the service desk or the name of the agent leaving the comment.

This causes some mail clients, including Outlook, to show the messages as being from the reporter instead of from JIRA Service Desk.
fields.summary: Reporter display name used as from name in email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Please have a look at the [attachment|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/thumbnail/135885/_thumb_135885.png], the black arrow shows the time which have to be tracked.

Problem is that its currently not possible to report the elapsed SLA time in Jira Service Desk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-931].
{panel}
We would like to user the service desk to allow customers to create bugs and feature requests through a simple interface on an existing Jira project. 
There would then be 'agents' that would curate these issues and then hand them to the development team if confirmed.
This all works nicely and as expected. The only problem is that the developers are not 'agents' but 'collaborators', and Service Desk therefore prevents them from editing / transitioning the issues.

It means we cannot streamline our support with our development process. We would need separate support and development projects and duplicate/link the issues between them.

Would it not be possible to remove this restriction? The collaborators should be able to do whatever their given permissions are. They don't need access to the full service desk view. We are still paying for their user license anyway. 
Agent licenses will still be needed (and purchased) to use the full Service Desk portal features. Otherwise it is a convoluted user experience.
fields.summary: Allow collaborators to modify issues dependent on their permissions
Options to Hide Atlassian Footer at Customer Portal
Make Service Desk documentation available as PDF download
Enable a single Service Desk to cover multiple projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-920].
  {panel}

JIRA Service Desk 2.0 introduced the role "Customers". Users with this role are banned from accessing JIRA functionality. That is for sure reasonable. The problem is that JIRA also deny request to the REST API's.

As add-on developers we would like the "Customer" role to have access to the plugins REST API's. If not, our [Insight add-on |https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight] will be impossible to enable on the Customer Portal for the "Customer" role. We can of course have simple custom field rendered from the server side, but our more advanced Insight custom field acts from the user behaviour and wouldn't scale if doing this from the server side

We have been asked why we like to share information/content to ServiceDesk "Customers". There are several reasons for that, but one example is if you are a company renting out video cameras, you want the customers to report bugs on those assets via the ServiceDesk portal. The assets is of course within the Insight plugin.

As of right now, our add-on works perfectly for users that have the USE permission but it doesn't work for users of the Customer role. We have several customers that really needs the Insight Custom Field to work for the "Customer" role so we hope you will make the REST-API open for the plugin developers to decide who can access the plugin services or not. 

The client request: https://domainname:port/rest/..  gets a HTTP 302. We cannot see any drawbacks by allowing access to the REST API's where you as today, are redirecting all requests. The authorization should be handled by the plugin developers as we do in any other case. 

Let me know if you have any questions or more information you need. This is very urgent for us. Thanks
fields.summary: Service Desk 2.0 - "Customers" are banned from accessing JIRA and Plugin REST API's

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-919].
  {panel}

Hi,

if we receive an issue e-Mail by an unknown E-Mail jira know sends an e-mail back with a request to create a service desk customer.

- At first we like to change the automated answer text to be more personal and fit our needs.

- The second thing is that we'd like to have a captcha query when creating a customer account for service desk by a customer with an unknown e-mail address to improve security. And of course for the customer portals when creating an issue. How can we activate that?

I did not find anything in the Wiki concerning that. The captcha thing is concerning to the "normal" Jira, but not to Jira ondemand.

Can you help us with that?
fields.summary: Captcha for creating customer accounts via E-Mail (Service Desk) and changing the automated response mail
Allowing Non-Agents to Transition Ticket Status (Service Desk 2.0)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-916].
  {panel}

Service Desk allows users to have KBs linked to Service Desks. However, the customers in the new billing model cannot be given permission to Confluence and will not be able to access the KB unless it is public.

As a user, since this KB is directly connected to the Service Desk, I'd like to be able to have my customers access the KB, even though it is private. Either allowing them to access Confluence somehow, or only the KBs.

h3. Partial work around
Where possible a 2-legged OAuth applink with a real Confluence user specified can be used to restrict access to Confluence while maintaining search functionality for Service Desk Customers. All searches will be made as the user specificed in the "Execute as" text box in the OAuth application link configuration. The application link cannot be use 2-legged OAuth impersonation as Service Desk Customers do not have Confluence user accounts.
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk customers access to private Service Desk KB's

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-914].
  {panel}

*Behavior*
After disabling Notifications in {{Add-ons >> Configuration}} under _JIRA Service Desk_, 'customer' users in Service Desk projects do not receive notifications as reporters on issues.

*Expected*
Once Service Desk Notifications are disabled, Service Desk projects should utilize the notification scheme defined in their corresponding JIRA project, including 'customers' as issue reporters.

*Workaround*
Adding the 'customer' users to the administrator project role for the JIRA project associated with the service desk or giving browse permission seems to allow the 'customer' to receive notifications as expected.
fields.summary: Service Desk Customer Not Treated as Reporter in JIRA Notification Scheme
Change our Public Signup docs to make more clear that it is only compatible with the new licensing model

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Since JIRA DESK HELP 2.0, customer should be able to choose their preference language like jira user

...and it's a high priority for international use

see 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10620

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-911].

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Login to Service Desk OnDemand as a customer
# Once logged in, do force reload (press ctrl+f5) in the browser

*Current result*:
The logo is not displayed (The image location is broken)

*Expected result*:
The logo should be displayed properly

JIRA Service Desk Branding
Add the ability to change the From address for notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-905].
  {panel}

JIRA doesn't allow Project administrators to change the Permission scheme associated to their projects if they do not have the JIRA Administrators Global Permission as well.

However, when a Project admin (not JIRA Administrator) creates a Service Desk for his project, he can migrate the permission scheme by clicking in the "Migrate this project" button.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have a Project Administrator without JIRA Administrators global permission
# Create a Service Desk for an already existent project
# Open the new Service Desk
# An error is displayed stating the project is missing permissions with a "Migrate this project" button at the bottom.

*Expected Behaviour*
JIRA should not allow non-JIRA Administrator to click on the button.

*Actual Behaviour*
non-JIRA Administrator is able to successfully change the project's permission scheme by clicking on the button.
fields.summary: Project administrator is able to migrate Permission Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-902].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have TEMPO plugin installed
# Have a project with Tempo Account field set (e.g.)
# Have a JIRA Service Desk for this project
# Add a request type on the JSD
# Map Tempo Account field to appear on this request type

*Expected Results:*
# JSD renders this field as a dropdown filled with the information on it.

*Actual Results:*
# JSD renders this field as a single text field, without auto-complete.
fields.summary: JSD is not rendering TEMPO fields correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-901].
  {panel}

Service Desk Collaborators are supposed to be able to 'collaborate' on service desk issues, but they cannot log time to service desk issues.

Even an Agent with all other permissions cannot log work on behalf of a collaborator.

I cannot think of a workaround short of creating a related ticket just for that person's involvement. Unfortunately, this is time consuming and wasteful.

Please allow collaborators to log time to a ticket, as otherwise it is very difficult to collaborate.
fields.summary: Collaborators Cannot Log Time to Tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-900].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

The new comment tab from Service Desk ("Responde to customer" and "Internal" tabs) is only available for users with the new license because of the new agents project role.

h3. Expected behaviour

Implement this panel based on the existing project roles from the old licenses as well so users who will keep the old license until the renewal date can also use this new feature.
fields.summary: Allow the new comment tab to be used with old license model
As a service desk administrator, I would like to have a way to customize the FROM address for email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-898].
  {panel}

The email response sent to customers includes a dead/inaccessible link (see attached file)

Steps to repro:
# Agent attaches an image to the issue
# Agent references the image inline in a comment using ! notation
# Agent posts comment.
#* *OK behavior* comment is correctly rendered in Jira
#* *Bug* email sent to customer contains dead link:

!Screen Shot 2014-10-02 at 4.01.47 PM.png!
fields.summary: Email response does not properly render inline images
Track deflection on knowledge base click-through
Provide the ability for admin to control Service Desk notification for status change
Allow customisation/branding of Help Center/Service Desk Portals page.
Assigning a customer with privileges to see all project issues
Ability to edit comment for customers in SAC
When email is sent to report an issue and people are CC'd, respect the cc list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-884].
  {panel}

Agent doesn't solve issues, developers solves issues.

In current permission scheme, all developers must have agent license, this is absurd.

I doesn't understand, why jira service desk locks permission on issues now, not only on customer request, but it cannot be changed, there are at least other two ways to solve this:
1) all jira users would have permission to transition issue, resolve issue and log work
2) jira service desk lock all permissions only on issue types, that added in service desk -> settings -> request types
fields.summary: Jira users permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-882].
  {panel}

When attempting to edit the Resolution by component/s report, I was unable due to an error. It states the component that I am editing is incorrect for the field, but the component it references is an invalid component. 

Unable to remove series either. 

See attached screen shots. 

Workaround: delete report and rebuild.
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Resolution by Component/s Report in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-881].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

The existing "Attach screenshot" module from JIRA is not available in the Customer Portal view of service desk.

h3. Expected behaviour

Even though there is an "Attachments" link, the "Attach screenshot" module is way faster than the process of generating the screenshot and then uploading it into the ticket.
fields.summary: As an user, we would like Service Desk's customer portal to include the "Attach Screenshot" module
Public Holiday Calendar - SLAs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-879].
  {panel}

If the System Language in JIRA is set to German, trying to create a project from Service Desk (ie from the Service Desk dropdown > Create new Service Desk) will fail.

To reproduce:

# Create fresh install of JIRA with new database
# Change system language to German (profile language can be English)
# Enter JSD license
# Should fail creating the Welcome Service Desk and any other time you try to create a new Service Desk

*workaround*
Switch the language to English to create atleast 1 Service Desk, and will then work.
fields.summary: System Language is not English before enabling Service Desk, fails to create project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-876].
  {panel}

We would like to be able to customise the service desk customer portal so that, for example, all users would first be required to search for their issue (much like on support.atlassian.com) and only then when they don't find a solution, be able to create a new ticket.

I would suggest the summary is filled in with what they have searched from.

I understand this functionality is kind of there, but
a) It would be better to search first, then create ticket, instead of going down a path to create a ticket to then see matching KB articles only to return to creating the ticket
b) it doesn't do partial word matching, so if their problem is, for example, keyboard not working, then we only get a match when "keyboard" is typed, but really we should see it when "key" is matched.
fields.summary: Ability to customise the Customer Portal
Create Issue link should always be present
Move issues between reporters portals
Provide quick actions for common tasks
Ability to set Assignee using the first CC'ed user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-869].
  {panel}

As the manager of a service desk team, I would like the ability to generate a report showing the amount of time my agents have logged over a period of time. 

Example Report:
* Shows all of my agents or the agents I select 
* Shows the past week in daily increments
* Line chart showing total amount of time logged by each agent on each of those seven days
fields.summary: Service Desk report showing time logged by agents

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-868].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 2 December 2021}
Hey all,

Timeline has slipped a little bit, but things are still progressing well. At this stage we have pushed delivery back to January 2022.

We are really looking forward to this one, it will be a great start to the year :)

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when users configure public signup for Service Desk there is no current feature that allows admins to restrict the public signup for specific email domains. While this feature exists for the JIRA public signup option there is no such option for Service Desk public signup. This lack of functionality results in security implications to companies who - for multiple reasons - need to restrict customer public signup for Service Desk only to a specific set of external customers/domains.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow restriction to particular domains and verification process for valid e-mails to avoid spam account creation.
h3. Workaround

It is possible to automatically remove tickets created from undesired domains by following the steps of the article below:
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-articles/Restrict-the-creation-of-tickets-of-your-Jira-Service-desk-Cloud/ba-p/1351965]
fields.summary: Include Domain Level Restrictions for Service Desk Public Signup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-867].
  {panel}

Whenever a customer is created in the new Service Desk billing, we cannot make this customer an agent in OnDemand. The [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+customers] states that customers cannot be added to groups or granted access to applications, but doesn’t mention how to turn a customer into an agent. It doesn’t seem to be currently possible.

Creating another user to the same person to be an agent is not a good solution, because the new user won’t have the data (avatar, history, issues reported, etc.) and will required a different email address. 

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create Customer in Service Desk in OnDemand
* Customer can never be an agent

*Workaround*
* Create another user as agent
** User will not have data from the other user and will need a different email address.
fields.summary: Unable to make customer an agent in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-866].
  {panel}

The *Customer Request Type* Custom Field created by JIRA Service Desk notes:
{quote}
Holds information about which Service Desk was used to create an issue. This custom field is created programmatically. Please do not remove.
{quote}

If the field is deleted it will be automatically recreated by service desk, and all data from the field is lost, but if user manually recreates the custom field while service desk is recreating the association, there is an issue with data association moving forward.

h3.Scenario to reproduce:
# Field is deleted accidentally
# User recreates Field manually and associated it screens for projects
# Service Desk Also Recreates the Field creating a duplicate that has no data associated with it
# Data is now stuck in non system created Custom Field and two fields exist
# No way to re-associate the data to the Service Desk Field

h3.Symptoms:
There will be a Customer Request Type Field in Details View pane on issues containing the Data for the field as well as Custom Portal Request Type showing "None" in the Right View Pane on the issue. (See Screenshots)

h3.Workaround:
- Take note of any data that you may need to reference in the future, with a comment on the ticket, because all data from the NON_System Field will be lost.
# Remove the Non-System *Customer Request Type* Custom Field from all screens and workflows
# Delete the Non-System *Customer Request Type* custom Field
# All Data in this field will be gone
# run a reindex

NOTE: Do not delete the *Customer Request Type* Custom Field created by Service desk.  This is the one Noting:
{quote}
*Customer Request Type*
Holds information about which Service Desk was used to create an issue. This custom field is created programmatically. *Please do not remove.*
{quote}
fields.summary: Deleting Customer Request Type Field created by Services Desk
Rename Service Desk Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-864].
  {panel}

h3. +Problem+
Currently, when a request is moved to a different service desk project where the reporter also has access, he will receive a notification. However, this notification is not clear:
* it doesn't say the request has been moved
* the message somehow says the request "has been resolved":
!move.png!

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a service desk project
# customer creates a request
# agent moves the request to a different service desk project
fields.summary: Updating notification when request is moved to a different project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-861].
  {panel}

At current we have an license for all our customers with Jira, however Jira Service Desk is not economical for the highest tier Atlassian customers.

We have a use case where customers want to:
1) Edit
2) Reopen
3) Initiate
4) Assign tickets
for all Service Desk Requests.

Whilst some people have 'anonymous' customers that do not have access to jira, we already have all our customers as jira-users and pay licenses for this ability (Unlimited).  When a Jira Service Desk project is enabled, however, this functionality is removed via the normal Jira Project View and only agents can make these changes.  This was not the case for 1.0.

This means that for non-agent features we need to add all users as agents, even though we do not need/want agent functionality for them.

To fix this, Jira Service Desk should not restrict to only agents normal jira access to edit, reopen or perform transitions.  All jira-users should be assignable owners.  Instead, the project permission scheme should be honoured.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk should not restrict Project actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-858].

Update 22/03/2021

Hi everyone,

I'm Jason, one of the Product Managers on Jira Service Management. We are currently reviewing all tickets regarding reporting functionality as we build a long-term strategy on reporting capabilities. I'd love to discuss your reporting needs and what we can do to make the holistic experience better. Please reach out to me at [jdcruz@atlassian.com.|mailto:jdcruz@atlassian.com.]

Cheers,
Jason and the Jira Service Management Team
{panel}
As a service desk administrator or leader of a service desk team, I would like the ability to receive service desk reports via email or share them with others via email. The ability to schedule these email reports is desired.

As a manager of multiple service desk teams, I would like to see these emails to contain reports from multiple service desks.
h6. Use Case Example:

I am the manager of a service desk and would like to receive a periodic (daily, weekly, monthly) email containing some of the reports in JIRA Service Desk.
 * I would also like to be able to send these reports to my service desk agents
fields.summary: Ability to email JIRA Service Desk reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-857].
  {panel}

Currently the [Managing Customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+customers] page does not seem to note that customers can be added by:

# Add as a JIRA user without adding them to any group or "JIRA Users" global permission
# Set service desk to be unrestricted

This should be mentioned in the documentation.
fields.summary: Update Managing Customers documentation to note customers can be users in JIRA with no groups when access is unrestricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-856].
  {panel}

Currently, if we have configured Service Desk Project permission different with the default set of permission it will give the agent a warning. But, the service desk project permission or any other settings is not always need to be the same as the default settings, there is still a scenario where the permission need to be changed to adapt a certain behaviour of the agent would like to have.

Therefore, it should be useful if there is an option to hide or remove the notification when an agent would like to have its own set of configuration. It is not have to remove it, to hide the notifiction to be not so obvious should be enough, where the agents could just clicked on it and review back the permission.

The notification:
!sdsper.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to "Hide/Ignore/Do not Remind me again" for notification in the top of a Service Desk Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-855].
  {panel}

When a request is created, the customer (or requester) is added as a watcher to that request. This is not visible in the Customer Portal but visible in the Agent view as well as JIRA issue view.

The fact that customers cannot access JIRA suggests that they should not be added as a watcher, except there's a special, technical reason for that. Indeed, if an agent manually tries to add a customer as a watcher, this error is thrown which sounds logical:
!watcher.png|thumbnail!

A clearer picture of how this works is highly appreciated.
fields.summary: Should Service Desk customers be added as watchers?
As a Service Desk Customer I want to see SLA information of a request
